name: macrocosmic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
considering any large organized system as a whole, rather than as a group of smaller systems: The laws that operate on a large, macrocosmic scale also operate on the microcosmic scale. He has a macrocosmic view of the world.
More examplesFewer examplesI couldn't see the connection between macrocosmic conflict and a person's own microcosmic spirits.He was trying to find out whether there was any larger, macrocosmic meaning to his life.Students who focus only on particular speciality areas may lack a macrocosmic understanding of the broader subject.
